chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 16 - Use/Threat of Force/Violence
1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 16 - Use/Threat of Force/Violence

result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam T. Schick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Any other sentence out there

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.  Fine and/or costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.

Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request
Defendant is to comply with all requirements of Sex Offender Registrtion Program.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any medication or drug except as may be specifically prescribed by a medical professional for defendant, and then shall be taken only as prescribed.
The defendant shall have no contact with the victim  of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.  Defendant shall have no contact with anyone under the age of 18 without prior approval of his agent.  
Defendant shall not have access to the Internet without approval of his agent.

The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.  
The defendant shall be tested for STD's and HIV and results shall be reported to the victim.
The defendant is to submit to an Alcohol and Other Drug Assessment (AODA) and follow the recommendations, releasing the findings to the agent.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Any other sentence out there

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adam T. Schick
